IRPact_modellierung.helper

Class ValueConversionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • IRPact_modellierung.helper.ValueConversionHelper

  • public class ValueConversionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to provide helper methods to convert values of one data type into another.

    • Method Detail

      • signToBoolean

        public static boolean signToBoolean(double doubleToConvert)
        Method to convert a numerical representation of a boolean value into a boolean value. Converts a double to false if it is 0.0 or smaller and true otherwise
        Parameters:
        doubleToConvert - The (double representation) value to convert to boolean
        Returns:
        true if numerical value > 0.0, false otherwise

      • SetToArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> SetToArrayList(java.util.Set<java.lang.Double> setToConvert)
                                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert a set of Double values to an array list. Implies no order, will just arrange them in an order (in which the set is processed).
        Parameters:
        setToConvert - Set of numbers to convert to a list
        Returns:
        (unsorted) ArrayList of the values within the set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the set is empty

      • arrayList2DtoPoint2D

        public static java.awt.geom.Point2D arrayList2DtoPoint2D(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> twoTuple)
                                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert a 2-tupel ArrayList representation of a point (with Double coordinates) into a Point2D(.Double) format
        Parameters:
        twoTuple - The two tuple (as an ArrayList of Double values) to convert to a point, with first coordinate as x-Coordinate, and second coordinate as y-Coordinate
        Returns:
        A Point2D.Double representation of the coordenates of the provided array list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the dimension of the parameter is not 2 (not a 2-tuple)

      • arrayListHashMapToArrayHashMap

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>[] arrayListHashMapToArrayHashMap(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> arrayListToConvert)
                                                                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert an ArrayList of HashMaps (of String-Object pairs) into an Array of HashMaps (of String-Object pairs)
        Parameters:
        arrayListToConvert - The ArrayList of hash maps that is to be converted to an array of hash maps
        Returns:
        An array consisting of the entries of the provided ArrayList
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when the array list to convert is empty

      • getCorrespondingNeeds

        public static java.util.Set<Need> getCorrespondingNeeds(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> needsSatisfied,
                                                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Need> needsMap)
                                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to select all needs from a String-Need map as from a set of Strings. Will look up each corresponding Need (for each String) and put them into a result set (provided every String is accounted for; if not an Exception will be thrown)
        Parameters:
        needsSatisfied - String representation of the needs satisfied whose corresponding needs are to be selected
        needsMap - The needs map, mapping the provided strings with their desired needs
        Returns:
        The set of Needs corresponding to the set of Strings provided, based on the String-Need map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown if the set of Strings is empty or one of them is not a key of the needsMap

      • arrayListToSet

        public static java.util.Set<java.lang.String> arrayListToSet(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> stringsToConvert)
                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to copy the strings contained in an Array list into a set. Will throw an exception if the array list is empty or an entry appear twice
        Parameters:
        stringsToConvert - The (Arraylist of) strings to convert into a set
        Returns:
        A set consisting of the strings contained in the provided array list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown if the array list is empty or contains duplicate entries

      • synchronousConsumerAgentsToConsumerAgents

        public static java.util.Set<ConsumerAgent> synchronousConsumerAgentsToConsumerAgents(java.util.Set<SynchronousConsumerAgent> agentsInCAG)
                                                                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert a set of SynchronousConsumerAgents to a set of ConsumerAgents
        Parameters:
        agentsInCAG - SynchronousConsumerAgents to be converted
        Returns:
        A set of the same SynchronousConsumerAgent as ConsumerAgents
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - will be thrown if the set to convert is empty

        public static java.util.Set<ProductGroup> ProductGroupCollectionToSet(java.util.Collection<ProductGroup> productGroups)
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert a Collection of productGroups to a set of these
        Parameters:
        productGroups - The Collection to convert to a set
        Returns:
        The product groups to be converted as a set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when collection is empty

      • IntegerFPDSetMapToIntegerProductSetMap

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<Product>> IntegerFPDSetMapToIntegerProductSetMap(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Set<FixedProductDescription>> initiallyAdoptedFPDs,
                                                                                                             SimulationContainer simulationContainer)
                                                                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert a map of Integer keys and sets of FixedProductDescription to a map of the same integer keys with set of products corresponding to the instances of the FixedProductDescriptions as values
        Parameters:
        initiallyAdoptedFPDs - The map which values are to be converted to sets
        simulationContainer - The container the simulation runs in
        Returns:
        A map of the same keys as the initiallyAdoptedFPDs with their values converted to sets of instances of the corresponding products
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be throw if the map is empty, the container is null, or a FixedProductDescription doesn't not have a corresponding product in the simulation

      • linkedHashMapToArrayList

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Value> linkedHashMapToArrayList(java.util.LinkedHashMap<Value,java.lang.Double> orderedFactorMap)
                                                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to convert an ordered LinkedHashMap of Value-Double pairs to an array list of the same order
        Parameters:
        orderedFactorMap - The (ordered) map to be converted
        Returns:
        An array list with the same order as the provided argument hash map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Gets thrown when the argument is an empty map

      • deriveCAGIntegerMap

        public static java.util.Map<ConsumerAgentGroup,java.lang.Integer> deriveCAGIntegerMap(java.util.Set<ConsumerAgentGroup> consumerAgentGroups,
                                                                                      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> consumerGroupIntegerMapping,
                                                                                      java.lang.String context)
                                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Method to transform a String-Integer map to a ConsumerAgentGroup-Integer map with the ConsumerAgentGroup corresponding to the keys of the String-Integer map. If a String doesn't refer to the name of a CAG given, it will throw an Exception
        Parameters:
        consumerAgentGroups - The potential keys for the CAG-Integer map
        consumerGroupIntegerMapping - The String-Integer map with the keys referring to existing CAGs
        context - A String describing the context the method was called from (for a more verbose Exception)
        Returns:
        A CAG-Integer map with the keys corresponding to the referred CAGs and the values being the respective values of the String-Integer map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Will be thrown when a key of the String-Integer map doesn't refer to an agent group given as argument
